Based on your preferences, I would recommend two movies from this list: 

1. "A Clockwork Orange" (1962) directed by Alexei Vitkovsky): This classic film is known for its controversial themes and powerful performances. The story revolves around a young man named Alexei, who has been convicted of murder and sentenced to 15 years in prison. The film explores the psychological effects of being locked up for such a long time, as well as the various ways in which Alexei attempts to cope with his situation, including through reading and writing, as well as through participating in various forms of physical exercise.

2. "Holes" (1998) directed by David Siegel): This highly acclaimed film is known for its thought-provoking themes and powerful performances. The story revolves around two young men named Brian and Greg, who have been convicted of murder and sentenced to 15 years in prison. The film explores the psychological effects of being locked up for such a long time, as well as the various ways in which Brian and Greg attempt to cope with their situation, including through reading and writing, as well as through participating in various forms of physical exercise.

In both of these movies, you will be able to witness some truly remarkable performances by the talented actors who portray the main characters. You will also be able to observe some thought-provoking themes that are explored in depth throughout the course of the films.
